ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Facilitates easy analysis of factorial experiments, including purely within-Ss designs (a.k.a. "repeated measures"), purely between-Ss designs, and mixed within-and-between-Ss designs. The functions in this package aim to provide simple, intuitive and consistent specification of data analysis and visualization. Visualization functions also include design visualization for pre-analysis data auditing, and correlation matrix visualization. Finally, this package includes functions for non-parametric analysis, including permutation tests and bootstrap resampling. The bootstrap function obtains predictions either by cell means or by more advanced/powerful mixed effects models, yielding predictions and confidence intervals that may be easily visualized at any level of the experiment's design.

Facilitates easy analysis of factorial experiments, including purely within-Ss designs (a.k.a. "repeated measures"), purely between-Ss designs, and mixed within-and-between-Ss designs. The functions in this package aim to provide simple, intuitive and consistent specification of data analysis and visualization. Visualization functions also include design visualization for pre-analysis data auditing, and correlation matrix visualization. Finally, this package includes functions for non-parametric analysis, including permutation tests and bootstrap resampling. The bootstrap function obtains predictions either by cell means or by more advanced/powerful mixed effects models, yielding predictions and confidence intervals that may be easily visualized at any level of the experiment's design.

name: r-ez
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '4.4-0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-ez
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ez_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ez/ez_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f8a98b46c7bf55972e9efc9be077e805b60a45ce3b2ec6cf77cd9cd249d2a828

build:
  number: 5
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass >=7.3_45
    - r-matrix >=1.2_7.1
    - r-car >=2.1_3
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.1.0
    - r-lme4 >=1.1_12
    - r-mgcv >=1.8_12
    - r-plyr >=1.8.4
    - r-reshape2 >=1.4.2
    - r-scales >=0.4.0
    - r-stringr >=1.1.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass >=7.3_45
    - r-matrix >=1.2_7.1
    - r-car >=2.1_3
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.1.0
    - r-lme4 >=1.1_12
    - r-mgcv >=1.8_12
    - r-plyr >=1.8.4
    - r-reshape2 >=1.4.2
    - r-scales >=0.4.0
    - r-stringr >=1.1.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('ez')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ez')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://github.com/mike-lawrence/ez
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: Facilitates easy analysis of factorial experiments, including purely within-Ss designs
    (a.k.a. "repeated measures"), purely between-Ss designs, and mixed within-and-between-Ss
    designs. The functions in this package aim to provide simple, intuitive and consistent
    specification of data analysis and visualization. Visualization functions also include
    design visualization for pre-analysis data auditing, and correlation matrix visualization.
    Finally, this package includes functions for non-parametric analysis, including
    permutation tests and bootstrap resampling. The bootstrap function obtains predictions
    either by cell means or by more advanced/powerful mixed effects models, yielding
    predictions and confidence intervals that may be easily visualized at any level
    of the experiment's design.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: ez
# Version: 4.4-0
# Date: 2016-11-01
# Title: Easy Analysis and Visualization of Factorial Experiments
# Author: Michael A. Lawrence <mike.lwrnc@gmail.com>
# Maintainer: Michael A. Lawrence <mike.lwrnc@gmail.com>
# URL: http://github.com/mike-lawrence/ez
# Depends: R (>= 3.1)
# Imports: car (>= 2.1-3), ggplot2 (>= 2.1.0), lme4 (>= 1.1-12), MASS (>= 7.3-45), Matrix (>= 1.2-7.1), mgcv (>= 1.8-12), plyr (>= 1.8.4), reshape2 (>= 1.4.2), scales (>= 0.4.0), stringr (>= 1.1.0)
# Description: Facilitates easy analysis of factorial experiments, including purely within-Ss designs (a.k.a. "repeated measures"), purely between-Ss designs, and mixed within-and-between-Ss designs. The functions in this package aim to provide simple, intuitive and consistent specification of data analysis and visualization. Visualization functions also include design visualization for pre-analysis data auditing, and correlation matrix visualization. Finally, this package includes functions for non-parametric analysis, including permutation tests and bootstrap resampling. The bootstrap function obtains predictions either by cell means or by more advanced/powerful mixed effects models, yielding predictions and confidence intervals that may be easily visualized at any level of the experiment's design.
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# LazyLoad: yes
# ByteCompile: true
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2016-11-02 01:40:15 UTC; mike
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2016-11-02 18:17:31
